intro: Euphrasia × pulchella, commonly known as the pretty willow herb, is a hybrid plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae, characterized by its delicate, often yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. Euphrasia × pulchella is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
